name: Radioiodine-Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinoma with Paraneoplastic Neurological Syndrome
chief_complaint: Persistent neck swelling with worsening tremors and difficulty speaking

lab_results.FDG-PET/CT: Diffuse skeletal and pulmonary metastases with intense cerebellar uptake

prognosis: Guarded (5-year survival <35%) with significant quality-of-life impairment from neurological symptoms
description: Aggressive form of thyroid cancer resistant to radioactive iodine treatment, accompanied by autoimmune-mediated cerebellar degeneration due to cross-reactivity between tumor antigens and Purkinje cells. Presents with both oncological and neurological deterioration.
risk_factors: Prior external beam radiation to neck
multiple_choice: Radioiodine-Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Carcinoma with Paraneoplastic Neurological Syndrome
